reviewText:
It's in PAL format that is not compatible with US DVD players. That's now shown on Amazon. If you buy it to play in the US you'll have to find software or a service to convert it to NTSC.
Update: I had the PAL converted to NTSC. The video quality is excellent considering that it's shot with a 1990's vintage handheld camera. However, the advertised subtitles are gone, perhaps lost in the conversion. I know some Spanish and was in Lima a few years before the film was made, so I can follow along, but if you lack those advantages you may be lost.
